27#include "../hb-set.hh"
28#include "../hb-priority-queue.hh"
29#include "../hb-serialize.hh"
30
31#ifndef GRAPH_GRAPH_HH
32#define GRAPH_GRAPH_HH
33
34namespace graph {
35
36/**
37 * Represents a serialized table in the form of a graph.
38 * Provides methods for modifying and reordering the graph.
39 */
40struct graph_t
41{
42 struct vertex_t
43 {
44 hb_serialize_context_t::object_t obj;
45 int64_t distance = 0 ;
46 int64_t space = 0 ;
47 hb_vector_t<unsigned> parents;
48 unsigned start = 0;
49 unsigned end = 0;
50 unsigned priority = 0;
51
52
53 bool link_positions_valid (unsigned num_objects, bool removed_nil)
54 {
55 hb_set_t assigned_bytes;
56 for (const auto& l : obj.real_links)
57 {
58 if (l.objidx >= num_objects
59 || (removed_nil && !l.objidx))
60 {
61 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr,
62 "Invalid graph. Invalid object index.");
63 return false;
64 }
65
66 unsigned start = l.position;
67 unsigned end = start + l.width - 1;
68
69 if (unlikely (l.width < 2 || l.width > 4))
70 {
71 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr,
72 "Invalid graph. Invalid link width.");
73 return false;
74 }
75
76 if (unlikely (end >= table_size ()))
77 {
78 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr,
79 "Invalid graph. Link position is out of bounds.");
80 return false;
81 }
82
83 if (unlikely (assigned_bytes.intersects (start, end)))
84 {
85 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr,
86 "Invalid graph. Found offsets whose positions overlap.");
87 return false;
88 }
89
90 assigned_bytes.add_range (a: start, b: end);
91 }
92
93 return !assigned_bytes.in_error ();
94 }
95
96 void normalize ()
97 {
98 obj.real_links.qsort ();
99 for (auto& l : obj.real_links)
100 {
101 for (unsigned i = 0; i < l.width; i++)
102 {
103 obj.head[l.position + i] = 0;
104 }
105 }
106 }
107
108 bool equals (const vertex_t& other,
109 const graph_t& graph,
110 const graph_t& other_graph,
111 unsigned depth) const
112 {
113 if (!(as_bytes () == other.as_bytes ()))
114 {
115 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr,
116 "vertex [%lu] bytes != [%lu] bytes, depth = %u",
117 (unsigned long) table_size (),
118 (unsigned long) other.table_size (),
119 depth);
120
121 auto a = as_bytes ();
122 auto b = other.as_bytes ();
123 while (a || b)
124 {
125 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr,
126 " 0x%x %s 0x%x", (unsigned) *a, (*a == *b) ? "==" : "!=", (unsigned) *b);
127 a++;
128 b++;
129 }
130 return false;
131 }
132
133 return links_equal (this_links: obj.real_links, other_links: other.obj.real_links, graph, other_graph, depth);
134 }
135
136 hb_bytes_t as_bytes () const
137 {
138 return hb_bytes_t (obj.head, table_size ());
139 }
140
141 friend void swap (vertex_t& a, vertex_t& b)
142 {
143 hb_swap (a.obj, b.obj);
144 hb_swap (a.distance, b.distance);
145 hb_swap (a.space, b.space);
146 hb_swap (a.parents, b.parents);
147 hb_swap (a.start, b.start);
148 hb_swap (a.end, b.end);
149 hb_swap (a.priority, b.priority);
150 }
151
152 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, unsigned>
153 position_to_index_map () const
154 {
155 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, unsigned> result;
156
157 for (const auto& l : obj.real_links) {
158 result.set (key: l.position, value: l.objidx);
159 }
160
161 return result;
162 }
163
164 bool is_shared () const
165 {
166 return parents.length > 1;
167 }
168
169 unsigned incoming_edges () const
170 {
171 return parents.length;
172 }
173
174 void remove_parent (unsigned parent_index)
175 {
176 for (unsigned i = 0; i < parents.length; i++)
177 {
178 if (parents[i] != parent_index) continue;
179 parents.remove_unordered (i);
180 break;
181 }
182 }
183
184 void remove_real_link (unsigned child_index, const void* offset)
185 {
186 for (unsigned i = 0; i < obj.real_links.length; i++)
187 {
188 auto& link = obj.real_links.arrayZ[i];
189 if (link.objidx != child_index)
190 continue;
191
192 if ((obj.head + link.position) != offset)
193 continue;
194
195 obj.real_links.remove_unordered (i);
196 return;
197 }
198 }
199
200 void remap_parents (const hb_vector_t<unsigned>& id_map)
201 {
202 for (unsigned i = 0; i < parents.length; i++)
203 parents[i] = id_map[parents[i]];
204 }
205
206 void remap_parent (unsigned old_index, unsigned new_index)
207 {
208 for (unsigned i = 0; i < parents.length; i++)
209 {
210 if (parents[i] == old_index)
211 parents[i] = new_index;
212 }
213 }
214
215 bool is_leaf () const
216 {
217 return !obj.real_links.length && !obj.virtual_links.length;
218 }
219
220 bool raise_priority ()
221 {
222 if (has_max_priority ()) return false;
223 priority++;
224 return true;
225 }
226
227 bool has_max_priority () const {
228 return priority >= 3;
229 }
230
231 size_t table_size () const {
232 return obj.tail - obj.head;
233 }
234
235 int64_t modified_distance (unsigned order) const
236 {
237 // TODO(garretrieger): once priority is high enough, should try
238 // setting distance = 0 which will force to sort immediately after
239 // it's parent where possible.
240
241 int64_t modified_distance =
242 hb_min (hb_max(distance + distance_modifier (), 0), 0x7FFFFFFFFFF);
243 if (has_max_priority ()) {
244 modified_distance = 0;
245 }
246 return (modified_distance << 18) | (0x003FFFF & order);
247 }
248
249 int64_t distance_modifier () const
250 {
251 if (!priority) return 0;
252 int64_t table_size = obj.tail - obj.head;
253
254 if (priority == 1)
255 return -table_size / 2;
256
257 return -table_size;
258 }
259
260 private:
261 bool links_equal (const hb_vector_t<hb_serialize_context_t::object_t::link_t>& this_links,
262 const hb_vector_t<hb_serialize_context_t::object_t::link_t>& other_links,
263 const graph_t& graph,
264 const graph_t& other_graph,
265 unsigned depth) const
266 {
267 auto a = this_links.iter ();
268 auto b = other_links.iter ();
269
270 while (a && b)
271 {
272 const auto& link_a = *a;
273 const auto& link_b = *b;
274
275 if (link_a.width != link_b.width ||
276 link_a.is_signed != link_b.is_signed ||
277 link_a.whence != link_b.whence ||
278 link_a.position != link_b.position ||
279 link_a.bias != link_b.bias)
280 return false;
281
282 if (!graph.vertices_[link_a.objidx].equals (
283 other: other_graph.vertices_[link_b.objidx], graph, other_graph, depth: depth + 1))
284 return false;
285
286 a++;
287 b++;
288 }
289
290 if (bool (a) != bool (b))
291 return false;
292
293 return true;
294 }
295 };
296
297 template <typename T>
298 struct vertex_and_table_t
299 {
300 vertex_and_table_t () : index (0), vertex (nullptr), table (nullptr)
301 {}
302
303 unsigned index;
304 vertex_t* vertex;
305 T* table;
306
307 operator bool () {
308 return table && vertex;
309 }
310 };
311
312 /*
313 * A topological sorting of an object graph. Ordered
314 * in reverse serialization order (first object in the
315 * serialization is at the end of the list). This matches
316 * the 'packed' object stack used internally in the
317 * serializer
318 */
319 template<typename T>
320 graph_t (const T& objects)
321 : parents_invalid (true),
322 distance_invalid (true),
323 positions_invalid (true),
324 successful (true),
325 buffers ()
326 {
327 num_roots_for_space_.push (v: 1);
328 bool removed_nil = false;
329 vertices_.alloc (size: objects.length);
330 vertices_scratch_.alloc (size: objects.length);
331 for (unsigned i = 0; i < objects.length; i++)
332 {
333 // If this graph came from a serialization buffer object 0 is the
334 // nil object. We don't need it for our purposes here so drop it.
335 if (i == 0 && !objects[i])
336 {
337 removed_nil = true;
338 continue;
339 }
340
341 vertex_t* v = vertices_.push ();
342 if (check_success (success: !vertices_.in_error ()))
343 v->obj = *objects[i];
344
345 check_success (success: v->link_positions_valid (num_objects: objects.length, removed_nil));
346
347 if (!removed_nil) continue;
348 // Fix indices to account for removed nil object.
349 for (auto& l : v->obj.all_links_writer ()) {
350 l.objidx--;
351 }
352 }
353 }
354
355 ~graph_t ()
356 {
357 vertices_.fini ();
358 for (char* b : buffers)
359 hb_free (ptr: b);
360 }
361
362 bool operator== (const graph_t& other) const
363 {
364 return root ().equals (other: other.root (), graph: *this, other_graph: other, depth: 0);
365 }
366
367 // Sorts links of all objects in a consistent manner and zeroes all offsets.
368 void normalize ()
369 {
370 for (auto& v : vertices_.writer ())
371 v.normalize ();
372 }
373
374 bool in_error () const
375 {
376 return !successful ||
377 vertices_.in_error () ||
378 num_roots_for_space_.in_error ();
379 }
380
381 const vertex_t& root () const
382 {
383 return vertices_[root_idx ()];
384 }
385
386 unsigned root_idx () const
387 {
388 // Object graphs are in reverse order, the first object is at the end
389 // of the vector. Since the graph is topologically sorted it's safe to
390 // assume the first object has no incoming edges.
391 return vertices_.length - 1;
392 }
393
394 const hb_serialize_context_t::object_t& object (unsigned i) const
395 {
396 return vertices_[i].obj;
397 }
398
399 void add_buffer (char* buffer)
400 {
401 buffers.push (v&: buffer);
402 }
403
404 /*
405 * Adds a 16 bit link from parent_id to child_id
406 */
407 template<typename T>
408 void add_link (T* offset,
409 unsigned parent_id,
410 unsigned child_id)
411 {
412 auto& v = vertices_[parent_id];
413 auto* link = v.obj.real_links.push ();
414 link->width = 2;
415 link->objidx = child_id;
416 link->position = (char*) offset - (char*) v.obj.head;
417 vertices_[child_id].parents.push (v&: parent_id);
418 }
419
420 /*
421 * Generates a new topological sorting of graph ordered by the shortest
422 * distance to each node if positions are marked as invalid.
423 */
424 void sort_shortest_distance_if_needed ()
425 {
426 if (!positions_invalid) return;
427 sort_shortest_distance ();
428 }
429
430
431 /*
432 * Generates a new topological sorting of graph ordered by the shortest
433 * distance to each node.
434 */
435 void sort_shortest_distance ()
436 {
437 positions_invalid = true;
438
439 if (vertices_.length <= 1) {
440 // Graph of 1 or less doesn't need sorting.
441 return;
442 }
443
444 update_distances ();
445
446 hb_priority_queue_t queue;
447 hb_vector_t<vertex_t> &sorted_graph = vertices_scratch_;
448 if (unlikely (!check_success (sorted_graph.resize (vertices_.length)))) return;
449 hb_vector_t<unsigned> id_map;
450 if (unlikely (!check_success (id_map.resize (vertices_.length)))) return;
451
452 hb_vector_t<unsigned> removed_edges;
453 if (unlikely (!check_success (removed_edges.resize (vertices_.length)))) return;
454 update_parents ();
455
456 queue.insert (priority: root ().modified_distance (order: 0), value: root_idx ());
457 int new_id = root_idx ();
458 unsigned order = 1;
459 while (!queue.in_error () && !queue.is_empty ())
460 {
461 unsigned next_id = queue.pop_minimum().second;
462
463 hb_swap (sorted_graph[new_id], vertices_[next_id]);
464 const vertex_t& next = sorted_graph[new_id];
465
466 if (unlikely (!check_success(new_id >= 0))) {
467 // We are out of ids. Which means we've visited a node more than once.
468 // This graph contains a cycle which is not allowed.
469 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr, "Invalid graph. Contains cycle.");
470 return;
471 }
472
473 id_map[next_id] = new_id--;
474
475 for (const auto& link : next.obj.all_links ()) {
476 removed_edges[link.objidx]++;
477 if (!(vertices_[link.objidx].incoming_edges () - removed_edges[link.objidx]))
478 // Add the order that the links were encountered to the priority.
479 // This ensures that ties between priorities objects are broken in a consistent
480 // way. More specifically this is set up so that if a set of objects have the same
481 // distance they'll be added to the topological order in the order that they are
482 // referenced from the parent object.
483 queue.insert (priority: vertices_[link.objidx].modified_distance (order: order++),
484 value: link.objidx);
485 }
486 }
487
488 check_success (success: !queue.in_error ());
489 check_success (success: !sorted_graph.in_error ());
490
491 remap_all_obj_indices (id_map, sorted_graph: &sorted_graph);
492 hb_swap (vertices_, sorted_graph);
493
494 if (!check_success (success: new_id == -1))
495 print_orphaned_nodes ();
496 }
497
498 /*
499 * Finds the set of nodes (placed into roots) that should be assigned unique spaces.
500 * More specifically this looks for the top most 24 bit or 32 bit links in the graph.
501 * Some special casing is done that is specific to the layout of GSUB/GPOS tables.
502 */
503 void find_space_roots (hb_set_t& visited, hb_set_t& roots)
504 {
505 int root_index = (int) root_idx ();
506 for (int i = root_index; i >= 0; i--)
507 {
508 if (visited.has (k: i)) continue;
509
510 // Only real links can form 32 bit spaces
511 for (auto& l : vertices_[i].obj.real_links)
512 {
513 if (l.is_signed || l.width < 3)
514 continue;
515
516 if (i == root_index && l.width == 3)
517 // Ignore 24bit links from the root node, this skips past the single 24bit
518 // pointer to the lookup list.
519 continue;
520
521 if (l.width == 3)
522 {
523 // A 24bit offset forms a root, unless there is 32bit offsets somewhere
524 // in it's subgraph, then those become the roots instead. This is to make sure
525 // that extension subtables beneath a 24bit lookup become the spaces instead
526 // of the offset to the lookup.
527 hb_set_t sub_roots;
528 find_32bit_roots (node_idx: l.objidx, found&: sub_roots);
529 if (sub_roots) {
530 for (unsigned sub_root_idx : sub_roots) {
531 roots.add (g: sub_root_idx);
532 find_subgraph (node_idx: sub_root_idx, subgraph&: visited);
533 }
534 continue;
535 }
536 }
537
538 roots.add (g: l.objidx);
539 find_subgraph (node_idx: l.objidx, subgraph&: visited);
540 }
541 }
542 }
543
544 template <typename T, typename ...Ts>
545 vertex_and_table_t<T> as_table (unsigned parent, const void* offset, Ts... ds)
546 {
547 return as_table_from_index<T> (index_for_offset (node_idx: parent, offset), std::forward<Ts>(ds)...);
548 }
549
550 template <typename T, typename ...Ts>
551 vertex_and_table_t<T> as_mutable_table (unsigned parent, const void* offset, Ts... ds)
552 {
553 return as_table_from_index<T> (mutable_index_for_offset (node_idx: parent, offset), std::forward<Ts>(ds)...);
554 }
555
556 template <typename T, typename ...Ts>
557 vertex_and_table_t<T> as_table_from_index (unsigned index, Ts... ds)
558 {
559 if (index >= vertices_.length)
560 return vertex_and_table_t<T> ();
561
562 vertex_and_table_t<T> r;
563 r.vertex = &vertices_[index];
564 r.table = (T*) r.vertex->obj.head;
565 r.index = index;
566 if (!r.table)
567 return vertex_and_table_t<T> ();
568
569 if (!r.table->sanitize (*(r.vertex), std::forward<Ts>(ds)...))
570 return vertex_and_table_t<T> ();
571
572 return r;
573 }
574
575 // Finds the object id of the object pointed to by the offset at 'offset'
576 // within object[node_idx].
577 unsigned index_for_offset (unsigned node_idx, const void* offset) const
578 {
579 const auto& node = object (i: node_idx);
580 if (offset < node.head || offset >= node.tail) return -1;
581
582 unsigned length = node.real_links.length;
583 for (unsigned i = 0; i < length; i++)
584 {
585 // Use direct access for increased performance, this is a hot method.
586 const auto& link = node.real_links.arrayZ[i];
587 if (offset != node.head + link.position)
588 continue;
589 return link.objidx;
590 }
591
592 return -1;
593 }
594
595 // Finds the object id of the object pointed to by the offset at 'offset'
596 // within object[node_idx]. Ensures that the returned object is safe to mutate.
597 // That is, if the original child object is shared by parents other than node_idx
598 // it will be duplicated and the duplicate will be returned instead.
599 unsigned mutable_index_for_offset (unsigned node_idx, const void* offset)
600 {
601 unsigned child_idx = index_for_offset (node_idx, offset);
602 auto& child = vertices_[child_idx];
603 for (unsigned p : child.parents)
604 {
605 if (p != node_idx) {
606 return duplicate (parent_idx: node_idx, child_idx);
607 }
608 }
609
610 return child_idx;
611 }
612
613
614 /*
615 * Assign unique space numbers to each connected subgraph of 24 bit and/or 32 bit offset(s).
616 * Currently, this is implemented specifically tailored to the structure of a GPOS/GSUB
617 * (including with 24bit offsets) table.
618 */
619 bool assign_spaces ()
620 {
621 update_parents ();
622
623 hb_set_t visited;
624 hb_set_t roots;
625 find_space_roots (visited, roots);
626
627 // Mark everything not in the subgraphs of the roots as visited. This prevents
628 // subgraphs from being connected via nodes not in those subgraphs.
629 visited.invert ();
630
631 if (!roots) return false;
632
633 while (roots)
634 {
635 uint32_t next = HB_SET_VALUE_INVALID;
636 if (unlikely (!check_success (!roots.in_error ()))) break;
637 if (!roots.next (codepoint: &next)) break;
638
639 hb_set_t connected_roots;
640 find_connected_nodes (start_idx: next, targets&: roots, visited, connected&: connected_roots);
641 if (unlikely (!check_success (!connected_roots.in_error ()))) break;
642
643 isolate_subgraph (roots&: connected_roots);
644 if (unlikely (!check_success (!connected_roots.in_error ()))) break;
645
646 unsigned next_space = this->next_space ();
647 num_roots_for_space_.push (v: 0);
648 for (unsigned root : connected_roots)
649 {
650 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr, "Subgraph %u gets space %u", root, next_space);
651 vertices_[root].space = next_space;
652 num_roots_for_space_[next_space] = num_roots_for_space_[next_space] + 1;
653 distance_invalid = true;
654 positions_invalid = true;
655 }
656
657 // TODO(grieger): special case for GSUB/GPOS use extension promotions to move 16 bit space
658 // into the 32 bit space as needed, instead of using isolation.
659 }
660
661
662
663 return true;
664 }
665
666 /*
667 * Isolates the subgraph of nodes reachable from root. Any links to nodes in the subgraph
668 * that originate from outside of the subgraph will be removed by duplicating the linked to
669 * object.
670 *
671 * Indices stored in roots will be updated if any of the roots are duplicated to new indices.
672 */
673 bool isolate_subgraph (hb_set_t& roots)
674 {
675 update_parents ();
676 hb_map_t subgraph;
677
678 // incoming edges to root_idx should be all 32 bit in length so we don't need to de-dup these
679 // set the subgraph incoming edge count to match all of root_idx's incoming edges
680 hb_set_t parents;
681 for (unsigned root_idx : roots)
682 {
683 subgraph.set (key: root_idx, value: wide_parents (node_idx: root_idx, parents));
684 find_subgraph (node_idx: root_idx, subgraph);
685 }
686
687 unsigned original_root_idx = root_idx ();
688 hb_map_t index_map;
689 bool made_changes = false;
690 for (auto entry : subgraph.iter ())
691 {
692 const auto& node = vertices_[entry.first];
693 unsigned subgraph_incoming_edges = entry.second;
694
695 if (subgraph_incoming_edges < node.incoming_edges ())
696 {
697 // Only de-dup objects with incoming links from outside the subgraph.
698 made_changes = true;
699 duplicate_subgraph (node_idx: entry.first, index_map);
700 }
701 }
702
703 if (in_error ())
704 return false;
705
706 if (!made_changes)
707 return false;
708
709 if (original_root_idx != root_idx ()
710 && parents.has (k: original_root_idx))
711 {
712 // If the root idx has changed since parents was determined, update root idx in parents
713 parents.add (g: root_idx ());
714 parents.del (g: original_root_idx);
715 }
716
717 auto new_subgraph =
718 + subgraph.keys ()
719 | hb_map([&] (uint32_t node_idx) {
720 const uint32_t *v;
721 if (index_map.has (key: node_idx, vp: &v)) return *v;
722 return node_idx;
723 })
724 ;
725
726 remap_obj_indices (id_map: index_map, subgraph: new_subgraph);
727 remap_obj_indices (id_map: index_map, subgraph: parents.iter (), only_wide: true);
728
729 // Update roots set with new indices as needed.
730 uint32_t next = HB_SET_VALUE_INVALID;
731 while (roots.next (codepoint: &next))
732 {
733 const uint32_t *v;
734 if (index_map.has (key: next, vp: &v))
735 {
736 roots.del (g: next);
737 roots.add (g: *v);
738 }
739 }
740
741 return true;
742 }
743
744 void find_subgraph (unsigned node_idx, hb_map_t& subgraph)
745 {
746 for (const auto& link : vertices_[node_idx].obj.all_links ())
747 {
748 const uint32_t *v;
749 if (subgraph.has (key: link.objidx, vp: &v))
750 {
751 subgraph.set (key: link.objidx, value: *v + 1);
752 continue;
753 }
754 subgraph.set (key: link.objidx, value: 1);
755 find_subgraph (node_idx: link.objidx, subgraph);
756 }
757 }
758
759 void find_subgraph (unsigned node_idx, hb_set_t& subgraph)
760 {
761 if (subgraph.has (k: node_idx)) return;
762 subgraph.add (g: node_idx);
763 for (const auto& link : vertices_[node_idx].obj.all_links ())
764 find_subgraph (node_idx: link.objidx, subgraph);
765 }
766
767 size_t find_subgraph_size (unsigned node_idx, hb_set_t& subgraph, unsigned max_depth = -1)
768 {
769 if (subgraph.has (k: node_idx)) return 0;
770 subgraph.add (g: node_idx);
771
772 const auto& o = vertices_[node_idx].obj;
773 size_t size = o.tail - o.head;
774 if (max_depth == 0)
775 return size;
776
777 for (const auto& link : o.all_links ())
778 size += find_subgraph_size (node_idx: link.objidx, subgraph, max_depth: max_depth - 1);
779 return size;
780 }
781
782 /*
783 * Finds the topmost children of 32bit offsets in the subgraph starting
784 * at node_idx. Found indices are placed into 'found'.
785 */
786 void find_32bit_roots (unsigned node_idx, hb_set_t& found)
787 {
788 for (const auto& link : vertices_[node_idx].obj.all_links ())
789 {
790 if (!link.is_signed && link.width == 4) {
791 found.add (g: link.objidx);
792 continue;
793 }
794 find_32bit_roots (node_idx: link.objidx, found);
795 }
796 }
797
798 /*
799 * Moves the child of old_parent_idx pointed to by old_offset to a new
800 * vertex at the new_offset.
801 */
802 template<typename O>
803 void move_child (unsigned old_parent_idx,
804 const O* old_offset,
805 unsigned new_parent_idx,
806 const O* new_offset)
807 {
808 distance_invalid = true;
809 positions_invalid = true;
810
811 auto& old_v = vertices_[old_parent_idx];
812 auto& new_v = vertices_[new_parent_idx];
813
814 unsigned child_id = index_for_offset (node_idx: old_parent_idx,
815 offset: old_offset);
816
817 auto* new_link = new_v.obj.real_links.push ();
818 new_link->width = O::static_size;
819 new_link->objidx = child_id;
820 new_link->position = (const char*) new_offset - (const char*) new_v.obj.head;
821
822 auto& child = vertices_[child_id];
823 child.parents.push (v&: new_parent_idx);
824
825 old_v.remove_real_link (child_index: child_id, offset: old_offset);
826 child.remove_parent (parent_index: old_parent_idx);
827 }
828
829 /*
830 * duplicates all nodes in the subgraph reachable from node_idx. Does not re-assign
831 * links. index_map is updated with mappings from old id to new id. If a duplication has already
832 * been performed for a given index, then it will be skipped.
833 */
834 void duplicate_subgraph (unsigned node_idx, hb_map_t& index_map)
835 {
836 if (index_map.has (key: node_idx))
837 return;
838
839 unsigned clone_idx = duplicate (node_idx);
840 if (!check_success (success: clone_idx != (unsigned) -1))
841 return;
842
843 index_map.set (key: node_idx, value&: clone_idx);
844 for (const auto& l : object (i: node_idx).all_links ()) {
845 duplicate_subgraph (node_idx: l.objidx, index_map);
846 }
847 }
848
849 /*
850 * Creates a copy of node_idx and returns it's new index.
851 */
852 unsigned duplicate (unsigned node_idx)
853 {
854 positions_invalid = true;
855 distance_invalid = true;
856
857 auto* clone = vertices_.push ();
858 auto& child = vertices_[node_idx];
859 if (vertices_.in_error ()) {
860 return -1;
861 }
862
863 clone->obj.head = child.obj.head;
864 clone->obj.tail = child.obj.tail;
865 clone->distance = child.distance;
866 clone->space = child.space;
867 clone->parents.reset ();
868
869 unsigned clone_idx = vertices_.length - 2;
870 for (const auto& l : child.obj.real_links)
871 {
872 clone->obj.real_links.push (v: l);
873 vertices_[l.objidx].parents.push (v&: clone_idx);
874 }
875 for (const auto& l : child.obj.virtual_links)
876 {
877 clone->obj.virtual_links.push (v: l);
878 vertices_[l.objidx].parents.push (v&: clone_idx);
879 }
880
881 check_success (success: !clone->obj.real_links.in_error ());
882 check_success (success: !clone->obj.virtual_links.in_error ());
883
884 // The last object is the root of the graph, so swap back the root to the end.
885 // The root's obj idx does change, however since it's root nothing else refers to it.
886 // all other obj idx's will be unaffected.
887 hb_swap (vertices_[vertices_.length - 2], *clone);
888
889 // Since the root moved, update the parents arrays of all children on the root.
890 for (const auto& l : root ().obj.all_links ())
891 vertices_[l.objidx].remap_parent (old_index: root_idx () - 1, new_index: root_idx ());
892
893 return clone_idx;
894 }
895
896 /*
897 * Creates a copy of child and re-assigns the link from
898 * parent to the clone. The copy is a shallow copy, objects
899 * linked from child are not duplicated.
900 */
901 unsigned duplicate_if_shared (unsigned parent_idx, unsigned child_idx)
902 {
903 unsigned new_idx = duplicate (parent_idx, child_idx);
904 if (new_idx == (unsigned) -1) return child_idx;
905 return new_idx;
906 }
907
908
909 /*
910 * Creates a copy of child and re-assigns the link from
911 * parent to the clone. The copy is a shallow copy, objects
912 * linked from child are not duplicated.
913 */
914 unsigned duplicate (unsigned parent_idx, unsigned child_idx)
915 {
916 update_parents ();
917
918 unsigned links_to_child = 0;
919 for (const auto& l : vertices_[parent_idx].obj.all_links ())
920 {
921 if (l.objidx == child_idx) links_to_child++;
922 }
923
924 if (vertices_[child_idx].incoming_edges () <= links_to_child)
925 {
926 // Can't duplicate this node, doing so would orphan the original one as all remaining links
927 // to child are from parent.
928 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr, " Not duplicating %u => %u",
929 parent_idx, child_idx);
930 return -1;
931 }
932
933 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr, " Duplicating %u => %u",
934 parent_idx, child_idx);
935
936 unsigned clone_idx = duplicate (node_idx: child_idx);
937 if (clone_idx == (unsigned) -1) return false;
938 // duplicate shifts the root node idx, so if parent_idx was root update it.
939 if (parent_idx == clone_idx) parent_idx++;
940
941 auto& parent = vertices_[parent_idx];
942 for (auto& l : parent.obj.all_links_writer ())
943 {
944 if (l.objidx != child_idx)
945 continue;
946
947 reassign_link (link&: l, parent_idx, new_idx: clone_idx);
948 }
949
950 return clone_idx;
951 }
952
953
954 /*
955 * Adds a new node to the graph, not connected to anything.
956 */
957 unsigned new_node (char* head, char* tail)
958 {
959 positions_invalid = true;
960 distance_invalid = true;
961
962 auto* clone = vertices_.push ();
963 if (vertices_.in_error ()) {
964 return -1;
965 }
966
967 clone->obj.head = head;
968 clone->obj.tail = tail;
969 clone->distance = 0;
970 clone->space = 0;
971
972 unsigned clone_idx = vertices_.length - 2;
973
974 // The last object is the root of the graph, so swap back the root to the end.
975 // The root's obj idx does change, however since it's root nothing else refers to it.
976 // all other obj idx's will be unaffected.
977 hb_swap (vertices_[vertices_.length - 2], *clone);
978
979 // Since the root moved, update the parents arrays of all children on the root.
980 for (const auto& l : root ().obj.all_links ())
981 vertices_[l.objidx].remap_parent (old_index: root_idx () - 1, new_index: root_idx ());
982
983 return clone_idx;
984 }
985
986 /*
987 * Raises the sorting priority of all children.
988 */
989 bool raise_childrens_priority (unsigned parent_idx)
990 {
991 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr, " Raising priority of all children of %u",
992 parent_idx);
993 // This operation doesn't change ordering until a sort is run, so no need
994 // to invalidate positions. It does not change graph structure so no need
995 // to update distances or edge counts.
996 auto& parent = vertices_[parent_idx].obj;
997 bool made_change = false;
998 for (auto& l : parent.all_links_writer ())
999 made_change |= vertices_[l.objidx].raise_priority ();
1000 return made_change;
1001 }
1002
1003 bool is_fully_connected ()
1004 {
1005 update_parents();
1006
1007 if (root().parents)
1008 // Root cannot have parents.
1009 return false;
1010
1011 for (unsigned i = 0; i < root_idx (); i++)
1012 {
1013 if (!vertices_[i].parents)
1014 return false;
1015 }
1016 return true;
1017 }

1019#if 0
1020 /*
1021 * Saves the current graph to a packed binary format which the repacker fuzzer takes
1022 * as a seed.
1023 */
1024 void save_fuzzer_seed (hb_tag_t tag) const
1025 {
1026 FILE* f = fopen ("./repacker_fuzzer_seed", "w");
1027 fwrite ((void*) &tag, sizeof (tag), 1, f);
1028
1029 uint16_t num_objects = vertices_.length;
1030 fwrite ((void*) &num_objects, sizeof (num_objects), 1, f);
1031
1032 for (const auto& v : vertices_)
1033 {
1034 uint16_t blob_size = v.table_size ();
1035 fwrite ((void*) &blob_size, sizeof (blob_size), 1, f);
1036 fwrite ((const void*) v.obj.head, blob_size, 1, f);
1037 }
1038
1039 uint16_t link_count = 0;
1040 for (const auto& v : vertices_)
1041 link_count += v.obj.real_links.length;
1042
1043 fwrite ((void*) &link_count, sizeof (link_count), 1, f);
1044
1045 typedef struct
1046 {
1047 uint16_t parent;
1048 uint16_t child;
1049 uint16_t position;
1050 uint8_t width;
1051 } link_t;
1052
1053 for (unsigned i = 0; i < vertices_.length; i++)
1054 {
1055 for (const auto& l : vertices_[i].obj.real_links)
1056 {
1057 link_t link {
1058 (uint16_t) i, (uint16_t) l.objidx,
1059 (uint16_t) l.position, (uint8_t) l.width
1060 };
1061 fwrite ((void*) &link, sizeof (link), 1, f);
1062 }
1063 }
1064
1065 fclose (f);
1066 }
1067#endif
1068
1069 void print_orphaned_nodes ()
1070 {
1071 if (!DEBUG_ENABLED(SUBSET_REPACK)) return;
1072
1073 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr, "Graph is not fully connected.");
1074 parents_invalid = true;
1075 update_parents();
1076
1077 if (root().parents) {
1078 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr, "Root node has incoming edges.");
1079 }
1080
1081 for (unsigned i = 0; i < root_idx (); i++)
1082 {
1083 const auto& v = vertices_[i];
1084 if (!v.parents)
1085 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET_REPACK, nullptr, "Node %u is orphaned.", i);
1086 }
1087 }
1088
1089 unsigned num_roots_for_space (unsigned space) const
1090 {
1091 return num_roots_for_space_[space];
1092 }
1093
1094 unsigned next_space () const
1095 {
1096 return num_roots_for_space_.length;
1097 }
1098
1099 void move_to_new_space (const hb_set_t& indices)
1100 {
1101 num_roots_for_space_.push (v: 0);
1102 unsigned new_space = num_roots_for_space_.length - 1;
1103
1104 for (unsigned index : indices) {
1105 auto& node = vertices_[index];
1106 num_roots_for_space_[node.space] = num_roots_for_space_[node.space] - 1;
1107 num_roots_for_space_[new_space] = num_roots_for_space_[new_space] + 1;
1108 node.space = new_space;
1109 distance_invalid = true;
1110 positions_invalid = true;
1111 }
1112 }
1113
1114 unsigned space_for (unsigned index, unsigned* root = nullptr) const
1115 {
1116 const auto& node = vertices_[index];
1117 if (node.space)
1118 {
1119 if (root != nullptr)
1120 *root = index;
1121 return node.space;
1122 }
1123
1124 if (!node.parents)
1125 {
1126 if (root)
1127 *root = index;
1128 return 0;
1129 }
1130
1131 return space_for (index: node.parents[0], root);
1132 }
1133
1134 void err_other_error () { this->successful = false; }
1135
1136 size_t total_size_in_bytes () const {
1137 size_t total_size = 0;
1138 for (unsigned i = 0; i < vertices_.length; i++) {
1139 size_t size = vertices_[i].obj.tail - vertices_[i].obj.head;
1140 total_size += size;
1141 }
1142 return total_size;
1143 }

1145
1146 private:
1147
1148 /*
1149 * Returns the numbers of incoming edges that are 24 or 32 bits wide.
1150 */
1151 unsigned wide_parents (unsigned node_idx, hb_set_t& parents) const
1152 {
1153 unsigned count = 0;
1154 hb_set_t visited;
1155 for (unsigned p : vertices_[node_idx].parents)
1156 {
1157 if (visited.has (k: p)) continue;
1158 visited.add (g: p);
1159
1160 // Only real links can be wide
1161 for (const auto& l : vertices_[p].obj.real_links)
1162 {
1163 if (l.objidx == node_idx
1164 && (l.width == 3 || l.width == 4)
1165 && !l.is_signed)
1166 {
1167 count++;
1168 parents.add (g: p);
1169 }
1170 }
1171 }
1172 return count;
1173 }
1174
1175 bool check_success (bool success)
1176 { return this->successful && (success || ((void) err_other_error (), false)); }
1177
1178 public:
1179 /*
1180 * Creates a map from objid to # of incoming edges.
1181 */
1182 void update_parents ()
1183 {
1184 if (!parents_invalid) return;
1185
1186 for (unsigned i = 0; i < vertices_.length; i++)
1187 vertices_[i].parents.reset ();
1188
1189 for (unsigned p = 0; p < vertices_.length; p++)
1190 {
1191 for (auto& l : vertices_[p].obj.all_links ())
1192 {
1193 vertices_[l.objidx].parents.push (v&: p);
1194 }
1195 }
1196
1197 for (unsigned i = 0; i < vertices_.length; i++)
1198 // parents arrays must be accurate or downstream operations like cycle detection
1199 // and sorting won't work correctly.
1200 check_success (success: !vertices_[i].parents.in_error ());
1201
1202 parents_invalid = false;
1203 }
1204
1205 /*
1206 * compute the serialized start and end positions for each vertex.
1207 */
1208 void update_positions ()
1209 {
1210 if (!positions_invalid) return;
1211
1212 unsigned current_pos = 0;
1213 for (int i = root_idx (); i >= 0; i--)
1214 {
1215 auto& v = vertices_[i];
1216 v.start = current_pos;
1217 current_pos += v.obj.tail - v.obj.head;
1218 v.end = current_pos;
1219 }
1220
1221 positions_invalid = false;
1222 }
1223
1224 /*
1225 * Finds the distance to each object in the graph
1226 * from the initial node.
1227 */
1228 void update_distances ()
1229 {
1230 if (!distance_invalid) return;
1231
1232 // Uses Dijkstra's algorithm to find all of the shortest distances.
1233 // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dijkstra%27s_algorithm
1234 //
1235 // Implementation Note:
1236 // Since our priority queue doesn't support fast priority decreases
1237 // we instead just add new entries into the queue when a priority changes.
1238 // Redundant ones are filtered out later on by the visited set.
1239 // According to https://www3.cs.stonybrook.edu/~rezaul/papers/TR-07-54.pdf
1240 // for practical performance this is faster then using a more advanced queue
1241 // (such as a fibonacci queue) with a fast decrease priority.
1242 for (unsigned i = 0; i < vertices_.length; i++)
1243 {
1244 if (i == vertices_.length - 1)
1245 vertices_[i].distance = 0;
1246 else
1247 vertices_[i].distance = hb_int_max (int64_t);
1248 }
1249
1250 hb_priority_queue_t queue;
1251 queue.insert (priority: 0, value: vertices_.length - 1);
1252
1253 hb_vector_t<bool> visited;
1254 visited.resize (size_: vertices_.length);
1255
1256 while (!queue.in_error () && !queue.is_empty ())
1257 {
1258 unsigned next_idx = queue.pop_minimum ().second;
1259 if (visited[next_idx]) continue;
1260 const auto& next = vertices_[next_idx];
1261 int64_t next_distance = vertices_[next_idx].distance;
1262 visited[next_idx] = true;
1263
1264 for (const auto& link : next.obj.all_links ())
1265 {
1266 if (visited[link.objidx]) continue;
1267
1268 const auto& child = vertices_[link.objidx].obj;
1269 unsigned link_width = link.width ? link.width : 4; // treat virtual offsets as 32 bits wide
1270 int64_t child_weight = (child.tail - child.head) +
1271 ((int64_t) 1 << (link_width * 8)) * (vertices_[link.objidx].space + 1);
1272 int64_t child_distance = next_distance + child_weight;
1273
1274 if (child_distance < vertices_[link.objidx].distance)
1275 {
1276 vertices_[link.objidx].distance = child_distance;
1277 queue.insert (priority: child_distance, value: link.objidx);
1278 }
1279 }
1280 }
1281
1282 check_success (success: !queue.in_error ());
1283 if (!check_success (success: queue.is_empty ()))
1284 {
1285 print_orphaned_nodes ();
1286 return;
1287 }
1288
1289 distance_invalid = false;
1290 }
1291
1292 private:
1293 /*
1294 * Updates a link in the graph to point to a different object. Corrects the
1295 * parents vector on the previous and new child nodes.
1296 */
1297 void reassign_link (hb_serialize_context_t::object_t::link_t& link,
1298 unsigned parent_idx,
1299 unsigned new_idx)
1300 {
1301 unsigned old_idx = link.objidx;
1302 link.objidx = new_idx;
1303 vertices_[old_idx].remove_parent (parent_index: parent_idx);
1304 vertices_[new_idx].parents.push (v&: parent_idx);
1305 }
1306
1307 /*
1308 * Updates all objidx's in all links using the provided mapping. Corrects incoming edge counts.
1309 */
1310 template<typename Iterator, hb_requires (hb_is_iterator (Iterator))>
1311 void remap_obj_indices (const hb_map_t& id_map,
1312 Iterator subgraph,
1313 bool only_wide = false)
1314 {
1315 if (!id_map) return;
1316 for (unsigned i : subgraph)
1317 {
1318 for (auto& link : vertices_[i].obj.all_links_writer ())
1319 {
1320 const uint32_t *v;
1321 if (!id_map.has (key: link.objidx, vp: &v)) continue;
1322 if (only_wide && !(link.width == 4 && !link.is_signed)) continue;
1323
1324 reassign_link (link, parent_idx: i, new_idx: *v);
1325 }
1326 }
1327 }
1328
1329 /*
1330 * Updates all objidx's in all links using the provided mapping.
1331 */
1332 void remap_all_obj_indices (const hb_vector_t<unsigned>& id_map,
1333 hb_vector_t<vertex_t>* sorted_graph) const
1334 {
1335 for (unsigned i = 0; i < sorted_graph->length; i++)
1336 {
1337 (*sorted_graph)[i].remap_parents (id_map);
1338 for (auto& link : (*sorted_graph)[i].obj.all_links_writer ())
1339 {
1340 link.objidx = id_map[link.objidx];
1341 }
1342 }
1343 }
1344
1345 /*
1346 * Finds all nodes in targets that are reachable from start_idx, nodes in visited will be skipped.
1347 * For this search the graph is treated as being undirected.
1348 *
1349 * Connected targets will be added to connected and removed from targets. All visited nodes
1350 * will be added to visited.
1351 */
1352 void find_connected_nodes (unsigned start_idx,
1353 hb_set_t& targets,
1354 hb_set_t& visited,
1355 hb_set_t& connected)
1356 {
1357 if (unlikely (!check_success (!visited.in_error ()))) return;
1358 if (visited.has (k: start_idx)) return;
1359 visited.add (g: start_idx);
1360
1361 if (targets.has (k: start_idx))
1362 {
1363 targets.del (g: start_idx);
1364 connected.add (g: start_idx);
1365 }
1366
1367 const auto& v = vertices_[start_idx];
1368
1369 // Graph is treated as undirected so search children and parents of start_idx
1370 for (const auto& l : v.obj.all_links ())
1371 find_connected_nodes (start_idx: l.objidx, targets, visited, connected);
1372
1373 for (unsigned p : v.parents)
1374 find_connected_nodes (start_idx: p, targets, visited, connected);
1375 }
1376
1377 public:
1378 // TODO(garretrieger): make private, will need to move most of offset overflow code into graph.
1379 hb_vector_t<vertex_t> vertices_;
1380 hb_vector_t<vertex_t> vertices_scratch_;
1381 private:
1382 bool parents_invalid;
1383 bool distance_invalid;
1384 bool positions_invalid;
1385 bool successful;
1386 hb_vector_t<unsigned> num_roots_for_space_;
1387 hb_vector_t<char*> buffers;
1388};
1389
1390}
